probability.last_reasoning: Shifting +2% to bear from base. RLUSD growth has potentially reversed (down ~$70M), three kill switches lack data, JGB yields are trending toward elevated threshold, and Fear & Greed at 14 indicates severe market stress. The mid-case probability edges up slightly as institutional infrastructure milestones (PermissionedDEX live, Ripple Prime white paper, Metallicus FedNow) provide optionality — but without deployment data, optionality doesn't convert to probability. Bull unchanged as no new catalysts.

bear_case.score_reasoning: Score elevated from baseline due to three compounding factors: (1) RLUSD potential contraction is the first observed reversal in a key kill switch metric, (2) three of five kill switches are data-blind with deadlines approaching, and (3) zero on-chain institutional deployment data 10 days after PermissionedDEX went live.

competing_infrastructure.name: SWIFT GPI
competing_infrastructure.status_text: SWIFT GPI continues processing $150T+ annually with incremental speed improvements. No XRPL integration announced — competitive displacement risk persists as SWIFT upgrades its rails.

competing_infrastructure.name: Visa B2B Connect
competing_infrastructure.status_text: Visa B2B Connect expanding but primarily focused on card-adjacent corridors; not directly competing with XRPL's target settlement use cases.

competing_infrastructure.name: JPMorgan Kinexys
competing_infrastructure.status_text: Kinexys (formerly Onyx) processes $2B+/day in institutional transactions on permissioned blockchain. Direct competitor to Ripple's institutional settlement thesis with existing bank relationships.

competing_infrastructure.name: BIS Project Nexus
competing_infrastructure.status_text: BIS Nexus connecting central bank RTGS systems directly — if successful, reduces the case for an intermediary settlement asset. Kill switch #9 remains active.

competing_infrastructure.name: Ethereum Institutional
competing_infrastructure.status_text: BlackRock's BUIDL fund on Ethereum, multiple RWA protocols gaining traction. Ethereum's institutional footprint for tokenization is growing faster than XRPL's in absolute terms.

bear_case.odl_stagnation: ODL volume data remains completely unavailable — cannot assess whether the core utility mechanism is growing, flat, or declining. This is the single largest informational gap in the thesis.
bear_case.token_velocity_concern: Token velocity data unavailable. If XRP is primarily used as a bridge currency with minimal hold time, price appreciation may be structurally limited regardless of volume growth.

macro_headwinds.name: Global Recession Risk
macro_headwinds.status_text: Fear & Greed at 14 (Extreme Fear), Section 122 tariffs active, and Hormuz escalation risk create a credible recession scenario that would reduce institutional risk appetite and delay adoption timelines.

macro_headwinds.name: Crypto Winter Signals
macro_headwinds.status_text: Extreme Fear reading and XRP at $1.37 (well below prior highs) could indicate early crypto winter conditions, though 5.5% daily bounce suggests some resilience.

macro_headwinds.name: Regulatory Reversal Risk
macro_headwinds.status_text: SEC settlement confirmed, 7 spot ETFs approved. Regulatory trajectory appears firmly supportive barring unexpected political shift.

macro_headwinds.name: Rate Hike Extension
macro_headwinds.status_text: US 10Y at 4.02% indicates rates staying higher for longer. BOJ hiking cycle complicates carry trade dynamics. Extended high-rate environment compresses risk asset valuations.

bear_case.bear_narrative: The XRP institutional settlement thesis is under multi-vector siege: SWIFT GPI already settles most cross-border payments in under 30 minutes, neutralizing XRP's foundational pain point — this was a critical blind spot we were not tracking. Simultaneously, zero verifiable ODL volume data, 40x USDC competitive dominance, advancing CBDC interop layers, and extreme fear at 14 despite confirmed catalysts collectively indicate the institutional demand narrative lacks evidentiary support. REDUCE EXPOSURE — maintain a monitoring position for ETF launch flow data and Q3 ODL disclosures, but the burden of proof has shifted decisively to the bull case.
